input_str = input()

is_palindrome = True
for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
        is_palindrome = False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')


#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2+1:]

#sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print("Yes")
else:
    print("No")

#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt and remove newline characters
line = txt.read().replace("\n", "")

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2:]

#sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"
